properties.ariaLabel: editablegeojsonlayer permalink

children.value: The Editable GeoJSON layer accepts a
and renders the features as editable polygons, lines, and points.

properties.ariaLabel: code classlanguage textmodecode functionobject optional permalink

children.value: property defines the mode used to handle user interaction events (e.g. pointer events) in order to accomplish edits. This can either be a constructor for an
There are a extensive number of modes that come out-of-the-box with nebula.gl. See

properties.ariaLabel: code classlanguage textmodeconfigcode object optional permalink

children.value: An arbitrary object used to further configure the current mode.
(Boolean, optional) - Enables snapping for modes that support snapping such as translate mode.
(Object[], optional) - An array of GeoJSON Features that can be snapped to. This property only needs to be specified if you want to snap to features in other deck.gl layers. All features in this

properties.ariaLabel: code classlanguage textselectedfeatureindexescode array optional permalink

children.value: property distinguishes which features to treat as selected.
Features are identified by their index in the collection.
Selection of a feature causes style accessors to render a different style, defined in function such as
will render edit handles. Only one feature may be selected while in mode

Note: make sure to pass in the same array instance on each render if you are not changing selection. Otherwise, nebula.gl may clear state on every render (e.g. may clear a drawing in progress if the viewport changes).

properties.ariaLabel: code classlanguage textoneditcode function optional permalink

children.value: event is the core event provided by this layer and must be handled in order to accept and render edits. The
To accept the edit as is, supply this object into the
prop on the next render cycle (e.g. by calling React's
To reject the edit, do nothing
You may also supply a modified version of this object into the
prop on the next render cycle (e.g. if you have your own snapping logic).
(String): The type of edit requested. One of:
: A position was added (either at the beginning, middle, or end of a feature's coordinates).
: A position was removed. Note: it may result in multiple positions being removed in order to maintain valid GeoJSON (e.g. removing a point from a triangular hole will remove the hole entirely).
: A new feature was added. Its index is reflected in
: A position finished moving (e.g. user finished dragging).
: A feature finished scaling (increase/decrease) (e.g. user finished dragging).
: A feature finished rotating (e.g. user finished dragging).
: A feature finished translating (e.g. user finished dragging).
: An edge started extruding (e.g. user started dragging).
: An edge finished extruding (e.g. user finished dragging).
(Array<number>): The indexes of the edited/added features.
or an object containing additional context about the edit. This is populated by the active mode, see

properties.ariaLabel: code classlanguage textpickablecode boolean optional permalink
code classlanguage textpickingradiuscode number optional permalink

children.value: Number of pixels around the mouse cursor used for picking. This value determines, for example, what feature is considered to be clicked and what is close enough to be snapped to.

properties.ariaLabel: code classlanguage textpickingdepthcode number optional permalink

children.value: Number of layers of overlapping features that will be picked. Useful in cases where features overlap.

properties.ariaLabel: geojsonlayer options permalink

children.value: are supported and function the same:
The following accessors function the same, but can accept additional arguments:
: indicates if the given feature is a selected feature

properties.ariaLabel: tentative features permalink

children.value: While creating a new feature in any of the
modes, portion of a feature which has not been "committed" yet can hold its own props. For example, in

mode, the tentative feature is the last line segment moving under the mouse. For polygons and ellipses, this would be the whole feature during drawing. Define the properties with the following accessors:
The following accessors default to the same values as the existing feature accessors above. The arguments in order:
: the segment/polygon that represents the tentative feature

properties.ariaLabel: edit handles permalink

children.value: Edit handles are the points rendered on a feature to indicate interactive capabilities (e.g. vertices that can be moved).
for positions half way between two other positions.

properties.ariaLabel: code classlanguage textedithandletypecode string optional permalink

children.value: : Edit handles rendered as provided icons
Edit handle objects can be represented by either points or icons.

properties.ariaLabel: code classlanguage textedithandleparameterscode object optional permalink

children.value: Set luma.gl parameters for handles (eg. depthTest, blend)

properties.ariaLabel: code classlanguage textedithandlepointradiusscalecode number optional permalink

code classlanguage textedithandlepointstrokewidthcode number optional permalink

children.value: Icon names mapped to icon definitions. See

properties.ariaLabel: code classlanguage textedithandleiconsizescalecode number  optional permalink
code classlanguage textgetedithandleiconcode function optional permalink

children.value: Method called to retrieve the icon name of each edit handle, returns string.

properties.ariaLabel: code classlanguage textgetedithandleiconsizecode function  number optional permalink

children.value: The height of each edit handle, in pixels.

properties.ariaLabel: code classlanguage textgetedithandleiconcolorcode function  array optional permalink

children.value: The rotating angle of each object, in degrees.
